text: All the people I know who played this game have it in their Top games of 2017. I will be uploading my own Top 10 as usual, but unlike 2016 where I almost struggled to find 10 games worthy of such a list, I unfortunately ran out of time to play tons of amazing 2017 games. Night in the Woods is one of those games.
author: SupraDarky

author: Hawlo

text: I'm really excited to play this game when I get around to it. For me it feels like Oxenfree, in that the characters are struggling with incredibly human things in incredibly human ways (minus the whole supernatural bit) and that is perhaps the most compelling of all story telling. As much as I want to see myself in Cpt. America or Commander Shepard... I see more of myself in Alex and her friends. I hope Night in the Woods has a similar vibe.
author: BombOmbBuddy

text: BombOmbBuddy it's probably one of my favorite games now, it hit me right in the feels so hard. Your comparison makes me want to play oxenfree, because yes, NITW is human as heck
author: Daedalus117

text: Daedalus117 Oh I can't recommend it enough, friend! I had the main character's face on my water bottle for ages until I lost it recently. The characters are so lovely, and there doesn't feel like one right way to play the story. It just feels like it happens, like life really. I can't sing praises enough for the game, really. The highest accolade I can give it is this: I want to hang out with the cast in real life. That's my own personal measure for a well written group of characters. Night School also has a new game coming out this year so if you like their work in Oxenfree there's more on tap!
author: BombOmbBuddy

text: Oxenfree is a great game, but it's more thriller with character development through conversation. I'd still recommend it though its great :D
author: Jeffrey Garcia

text: it's an amazing game. The only real downside would be a sorta flat ending. but if you like great characters you will love this game. If you liked Oxenfree you will definitively love this one.

text: Just a personal recommendation for those playing for the first time: Don't play the bass in your room until after the first band practice. The first song you play in the game really sticks with you.
